articles.title: Supreme Court Dismisses Case on Title 42
articles.description: The justices acted after the Biden administration announced that the health emergency used to justify the measure, Title 42, was ending.
articles.content:
The Supreme Court on Thursday dismissed an attempt by Republican-led states to maintain the pandemic-era immigration measure known as Title 42.
The court’s brief order was one sentence long, instructing an appeals court to dismiss the states’ motion ... [812 chars]

articles.title: FDA advisers vote in support of new RSV vaccine to protect newborns
articles.description: The US Food and Drug Administration’s independent vaccine advisers voted Thursday in favor of recommending approval of a new vaccine to protect infants from respiratory syncytial virus, known as RSV.
articles.content:

articles.title: Indiana Jones 5 Stuns Cannes With Standing Ovation for Harrison Ford
articles.description: Harrison Ford said goodbye to Indiana Jones at the Cannes Film Festival, where "Dial of Destiny" made its long-awaited world premiere.
articles.content:
It turns out Indiana Jones can be a softie.
Harrison Ford fought back tears at one of the biggest premieres at this year’s Cannes Film Festival. No expense was spared as Disney jetted its top executives, including CEO Bob Iger, to the South of France... [2702 chars]

articles.title: What Would Happen if the U.S. Defaulted on Its Debt
articles.description: Investors, executives and economists are preparing contingency plans as they consider the turmoil that would result from a default in the $24 trillion U.S. Treasury market.
articles.content:
The U.S. debt limit has been reached and the Treasury Department is finding ways to save cash. After it runs out of maneuvers, what once seemed unfathomable could become reality: The United States defaults.
What happens next?
The far-reaching effects... [958 chars]

articles.title: El Niño Is Coming-and Global Economies Could Lose Trillions
articles.description: El Niño's effects on GDP worldwide can be felt for years after the climactic shift is over, a new study finds.
